required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of TAS0612 in Participants With Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumor Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Study of TAS0612 in Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see if TAS0612 is safe in participants with advanced or metastatic solid tumor cancer.

primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with DLTs during cycle 1

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through measured progressive disease (estimated up to 24 months)
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with partial response (PR) or complete response (CR) as defined by the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) v1.1.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through progressive disease (estimated up to 24 months)
secondary_outcome.description: DCR: Percentage of participants who exhibit stable disease (SD), PR or CR.
DOR: Date of PR or CR to date of objective progression or death due to any cause.
Baseline to objective progression or death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) of TAS0612
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 1 through Cycle 1 Day 15 (28 day cycle)
Cycle 1 Day 1 through Cycle 1 Day 15 (28 day cycle)

secondary_outcome.measure: PK: Area under the plasma concentration curve (AUC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 1 through Cycle 1 Day 15 (28 day cycle)

secondary_outcome.measure: PK: Time it takes to reach Cmax (Tmax) of TAS0612
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 1 through Cycle 1 Day 15 (28 day cycle)

secondary_outcome.measure: PK: Time it takes for plasma concentration to fall by half its original value (t1/2) of TAS0612
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 1 through Cycle 1 Day 15 (28 day cycle)

secondary_outcome.description: All adverse events (AEs) per CTCAE v5.0

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 1 through Cycle 1 Day 15 (28-day cycle)
secondary_outcome.description: Total proteins and phospho-proteins will be measured in blood samples collected at different time points. The levels/changes (dose- and concentration-dependent) of phospho-proteins will be assessed and reported for biochemical effects of TAS0612.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamic: molecular effects in tumor tissue of TAS0612
secondary_outcome.description: Selected phospho-proteins will be analyzed in tumor tissue at baseline and on-treatment in dose escalation. The levels/changes of the phospho-proteins will be assessed and reported for target modulation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Dose Escalation: have evidence of a solid tumor that is locally advanced and/or metastatic (excluding primary brain tumor)
- Dose Expansion: have evidence of a solid tumor as outlined below that is locally advanced and/or metastatic (excluding primary brain tumor)
- Cohort A: Human epidermal growth factor negative (HER2 negative) Breast Cancer with an NF1 mutation
- Cohort B: Hormone receptor positive (HR+)/HER2 negative breast cancer after progression on endocrine therapy and a CDK4/6 inhibitor
- Cohort C: PTEN loss or mutations
- Cohort D: KRAS G12C mutation
- Cohort E: KRAS G12D mutation
- Have adequate organ function
- Amenable to biopsy
- Have a performance status of 0 or 1 on the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) scale
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participating in medical research not compatible with this study
- Have not discontinued or recovered from previous treatments for cancer
- Have a significant cardiac condition
- Have untreated brain metastases
- Have a primary brain tumor
- Have a serious concomitant disorder
- Unable to swallow or digest pills
- Poorly controlled diabetes
- Concomitant medications or substances that are strong inhibitors/inducers of CYP3A.Study

facility.name: University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center
Centre de Lutte Contre le Cancer Gustave Roussy
